news.title: Fed chair candidate Hassett says U.S. is way behind the curve on lowering interest rates
news.description: Hassett said the artificial intelligence boom is boosting economic growth while simultaneously putting downward pressure on inflation.

news.title: Citadel to return $5 billion in profit to investors, source says
news.description: The firm's flagship multistrategy fund, known as Wellington, gained 9.3% in the year through last week, the person said.

news.title: Trump administration to start seizing pay of defaulted student loan borrowers in January
news.description: The Trump administration will start garnishing the wages of student loan borrowers in default in early January.

news.title: Epstein files: Latest batch from DOJ includes a personal letter, emails and heavily redacted documents
news.description: The release comes amid intense scrutiny from congressional lawmakers and victims over the DOJ's handling of the Epstein files.

news.title: Nvidia and this athleisure maker saw big insider selling last week
news.description: A CNBC Pro data analysis shows insiders sold many shares of Nvidia, Lululemon Athletica, Las Vegas Sands, Gap and other stocks last week

news.title: Southwest's profits are down 42% this year but it's the top U.S. airline stock
news.description: Southwest's stock has gained nearly 24% so far this year, more than any other airline.

news.title: The next AI pivot will be toward efficiency and lowering costs, ex-Facebook privacy chief says
news.description: Former Facebook privacy chief Chris Kelly said that AI companies will focus on creating efficiencies for training models.

news.title: U.S. pushes additional tariffs on Chinese chips to June 2027
news.description: As part of an investigation that kicked off a year ago, the agency found that China is engaging in unfair trade practices in the industry.

news.title: U.S. economy grows by 4.3% in third quarter, much more than expected, delayed report shows
news.description: The U.S. economy grew at a much greater-than-expected pace in the third quarter, boosted by strong consumer spending, a delayed report released Tuesday showed.

news.title: Gold and silver reach fresh highs for second day running — and could keep climbing
news.description: David Neuhauser, CIO at Livermore Partners, told CNBC's "Access Middle East" that gold has more room to run.

news.title: ‘No doubt’ U.S. economy is slowing, Invesco says, tipping Europe to outperform
news.description: Invesco's Ben Gutteridge sees a mid-cycle slowdown in the U.S., with Europe poised to outperform in 2026.

news.title: Inside the rise of Gen Z’s nostalgia-fueled plush-toy craze as they delay adulthood
news.description: "The economy, the wars, everything is really depressing and serious, whereas toys just bring a little bit of joy back into life," one toy director said.

news.title: Here's how AI could influence the Fed's economic outlook
news.description: Artificial intelligence could produce faster gains in worker productivity, altering the U.S. labor market and the Federal Reserve's economic outlook.

news.title: EV realism is here. How automakers react in 2026 will be telling
news.description: Detroit automakers are refocusing on large gas-guzzling trucks and SUVs, and many have admitted that policies, not consumers, were driving the charge for EVs.

news.title: Hanwha Ocean shares jump 10% after Trump says South Korean firm to build warships for U.S. Navy
news.description: Trump said that the frigates will be built at the Philadelphia shipyards, which Hanwha had invested $5 billion into.

news.title: Gas prices fall to four-year lows as millions embark on holiday road trips
news.description: The average price of unleaded gasoline in the U.S. is at its lowest since 2021, according to AAA.

news.title: Trust these numbers? Economists see a lot of flaws in delayed CPI report showing downward inflation
news.description: Thursday saw the release of a much lighter-than-expected inflation report for November, and economists are already questioning its significance.

news.title: November consumer prices rose at a 2.7% annual rate, lower than expected, delayed data shows
news.description: Economists polled by Dow Jones expected CPI to have risen 3.1% on an annualized basis.

news.title: Bank of England cuts interest rates, in welcome Christmas boost for consumers
news.description: The Bank of England voted to cut interest rates from 4% to 3.75% in its last monetary policy move of 2025.

news.title: November's inflation report is the first to be released after the shutdown. Here's what to expect
news.description: November's CPI report is expected to show the annual inflation rate at 3.1%, according to economists polled by Dow Jones.

news.title: Watch Fed Governor Christopher Waller speak on interest rates and the race to succeed Powell
news.description: Waller is one of the five finalists considered for to replace Fed Chairman Jerome Powell when his term expires in May.

news.title: Why we put Alphabet back in the Bullpen — plus, Cramer's case for Nvidia in 2026
news.description: The Investing Club holds its "Morning Meeting" every weekday at 10:20 a.m. ET.

news.title: ServiceNow's deal blitz gives it an 'AI control tower,' CEO McDermott tells CNBC
news.description: The enterprise software company said the deal will bolster its cybersecurity capabilities in the age of artificial intelligence.

news.title: Novo Nordisk's new obesity pill, Alphabet's data center deal, the end of EV euphoria and more in Morning Squawk
news.description: Here are five key things investors need to know to start the trading day.

news.title: Greenland PM rebukes Trump special envoy overture
news.description: President Donald Trump on Sunday appointed Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry as a "special envoy" to Greenland.

news.title: Crypto laments loss of key ally on Capitol Hill after Lummis announces retirement
news.description: Sen. Cynthia Lummis’ retirement tees up a Republican primary in Wyoming, where the victor will be heavily favored in November.

news.title: Epstein Files: Schumer to force Senate vote on suing DOJ over partial release
news.description: President Donald Trump signed a law compelling the full release of the Jeffrey Epstein files. But the DOJ has released just a fraction.

news.title: Epstein files: DOJ restores image showing Trump after backlash
news.description: The Department of Justice faces criticism for not releasing all of the Epstein files on Friday, despite a law signed by President Donald Trump requiring it.

news.title: Kremlin says peace prospects not improved by Europe, Ukraine changes to U.S. proposals
news.description: European and Ukrainian negotiators have been discussing changes to a U.S. set of proposals for an agreement to end the nearly four-year-old war.
